meanings.definition: A person who is overly concerned with their appearance and mannerisms.
meanings.sent1: The nancier spent hours in front of the mirror perfecting his hairstyle.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the nancier of the group, always fussing over her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The nancier's obsession with his looks sometimes made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her brother teased her, calling her the nancier of the family.
meanings.sent5: The nancier's attention to detail in his clothing was unmatched.

meanings.definition: To behave in an effeminate or overly delicate manner.
meanings.sent1: He would nancier around the room, carefully arranging the flowers.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to nancier in front of the tough crowd.
meanings.sent3: The big tough guy decided to nancier for a change, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The cat seemed to nancier as it delicately stepped over the puddle.
meanings.sent5: The actor had to nancier on stage to play the role convincingly.
